name: Hotel Una

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We loved our stay at Hotel Una. We went with another couple to celebrate my husbands 40th Birthday. Our room 'Eden' was stunning, Lovely bath,bed and balcolny ( you get all the afternoon/evening sun!) We had to drag ourselves away to go and see the sights. The most impressive feature of the hotel however was the staff! nothing was to much trouble. Everyone was fun, helpful, kind, considerate and efficient. Well done to all of you! I would say that the hotel caters for all types of custom, Families with young and older children, groups of friends, couples and retired allsorts, execpt large hen or stag parties mostly due to the fact they can be a nuisance to other guests. We shall be going back this summer with the kids. Cant wait, a true jewel in the regency crown!
reviews.title: The Best Hotel in Brighton!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Where do you start when trying to describe the Hotel Una? Quite apart from it's beautiful setting in Regency Square and it's stone-throw walk to the beach and West Pier, it's just the LOVELIEST hotel I've ever stayed in!
reviews.title: Lovely lovely lovely!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a great example of the phrase 'small, but perfectly formed'. My room (Gaula) was probably not much bigger than my own bedroom, but they have worked wonders with the space. An enormous double bed in the middle of the room. A little set of wooden steps leading out of the window to a private covered balcony with sofa and pot plants. Huge tv on the wall. Steps up to a gorgeous marble bathroom with super power shower and Molten Brown toiletries. Fluffy dressing gowns. Big leather chaise longue. Fair Trade/organic coffees, teas and hot chocolate with complimentary mineral water (take note Hilton Hotels!!) You get WAY more for your money here than you would at the nearby Holiday Inn or Premier Inn.
reviews.title: met expectations, good boutique style hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and friendly. I went to the bar after dinner for a read and a cocktail, and the barman offered to a) turn the lights up for me if I found it too dim to read by, and b) turn the music down if it was too loud for me! Brilliant service!
reviews.title: Superb Weekend Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious and hot and plentiful. They have a small buffet for fruit, juices, croissants, cereal etc, and then a menu for the hot food including full English, smoked salmon and scrambled eggs and eggs benedict.
reviews.title: The only place to stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can't fault our night away at the Hotel Una. Fantastic!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel just as other reviewers have said.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Loved this hotel! Great room, (Flores) very comfortable bed, lovely bathtub. Nicely decorated - very unique. Staff were extremely helpful, getting food, train tickets, anything we needed they were 'on it'. We wanted a restaurant recommendation and they took one look at us and recommended exactly the right one for us!
reviews.title: An excellent way to do Brighton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing I would improve - they could use some unscented toiletries and cleaning products. Strong scents to bed linens and bathroom products. We're sensitive to those things, so we noticed that.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from that it was WONDERFUL! Next time we're in Brighton it will be our home once more!
reviews.title: Lived up to expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010
reviews.text: Best ever hotel in Brighton (in my opinion). Location great, rooms beautiful (one we were in anyway -"Lossie"). Staff couldn;t have been more helpful or welcoming. Can' t wait to go again AND perfect location.
reviews.title: Very friendly staff, a great welcome...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night when going to a gig at the Brighton Centre. It is ideally located for the Brighton Centre.
reviews.title: A nice play to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in went smoothly and we were shown to our rooms and helped with our bags. Mine had the free-standing bath in the window; pretty pointless but kinda fun. The rooms (and hotel) are contemporary and nicely done. There is no disguising that the hotel is a converted house, and corridors etc get a bit narrow here-and-there.
reviews.title: Serene!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar is open 24 hours!
reviews.title: one of the worst ive stayed in brighton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was good.
reviews.title: Excellent stylish hotel with exceptional service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: We arrived at 4pm to find a major power failure. No heat/lights etc. So after guaranteeing that their maintenance were on the case they gave us, free of charge two large glasses of wine and nibbles. Power duly restored at 5pm (as they said it would be ) ,hot water 15 minutes later and our room upgraded free of charge. A tour of all the rooms viewable was given, each very individual. Quality oozes, staff polite, friendly and on your level. No pomposity here, they don't need it as they are so good anyway.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, lovely people - very personal and personable service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a change from the big hotels of London. After getting stuck in Europe (thanks Iceland Volcano) we decided to get out of London while waiting for a flight home and found this to Trip Advisor. This is a small hotel with all the character you might expect from a small hotel. I travel a lot ,and cannot ever recall a friendlier staff than this one. We asked about where to find live music and they not only gave us a run down, they emailed us reviews and more information. We asked about restaurants and they practically gave us a tour of the city.
reviews.title: Friendliest Staff Ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bar is outstanding with great bartenders and lots of friendly conversation. The included breakfast was delicious and made to order.
reviews.title: Chic experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are small - they make excellent use of the space and are very interesting from an architectural viewpoint, but they are definitely small. The bed, however, was very comfortable and we enjoyed a good night's sleep each night we were there.
reviews.title: Great service and rooms, we will return in the summer!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Una and would definitely recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Fabulous from checking-in to cocktails to sad farewell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night whilst visiting Brighton.
reviews.title: Great location, really helpful staff

description: Warm and friendly, elegant and fashionable, obsessive with detail. Classy Boutique hotel with the unique combination of contrasting textures, natural woods and contemporary artwork. Situated in Regency Square, with a great view of the West Pier, this chic and exclusive hotel offers you a selection of 20 individually designed en suite rooms including two luxury suites with private Sauna & Jacuzzi, an intimate bar, and an option of massages from a specialist physiotherapist.
